I agree with this however it's important to ensure we arn't jumping to the opposite extreme either. There should be a middle group where the designers arn't pigeon holed into staying away from anything sexy. Sex appeal exists and we shouldn't shame the designers into thinking they can never release a champ with sex appeal out of fears of being mobbed with complaints; when it makes sense for that champions background.
I feel like a decent number of champs do fit in this middle ground.  Examples being Quinn, Leona and Ezreal.  They are all attractive but not sexy in the typical sense.

What was the hardest part of her kit to code/design and why?

I would guess her Ult was the hardest part of the kit to deal with due to handling ending it on a wall.

The E wouldn't be too tricky. I don't know your background in coding, but if you created an object for every active E on the map, it wouldn't be too hard to track things within it, such as which Champions had already interacted with the E and how many times. And the best way to keep track of a currently occurring displacement (as a guess) is to set a flag when the Champion is being displaced or dashing (which they probably also use to make sure you can't input any other movement while doing this). So they just check that while the Champion is in the minefield and if the flag is set it triggers the mines. It would be the same check happening when you're in Poppy's Steadfast Presence. Since it's all been done before it shouldn't be too hard to tweak.

This is all a guess though, just how I would have tried writing it as a first attempt and they probably have a more efficient way of doing it.
Yes I did consider that method, but for the ult, they probably just used the same kind of thing for if a player uses a blink ability.

Just for fun, I'm going to guess that her E was the hardest to do.  It was likely a bit difficult to make it dash-sensitive (including knockbacks and pulls) while also limiting it to 4 popping per champion.
Maybe making the ult a fluid wall creation as she moves across it rather than the instantaneous ones like Anivia's and Trundles was difficult as well.
if she starts getting traction as support can you promise you won't nerf it just because it's not in the midlane flashzone anymore?

I doubt i will get a reply, but at least I can make the attempt to be heard with good questions. If you do reply, thank you very much for your time, keep up the good work.

- Is the ultimate ability going to deal some sort of damage? When you say minutes on worked ground, how long is it exactly?
 We're going to see this champion played in more roles than mid right? Are you guys going to display the amount of Mov.Spd she gains when wall riding? 
- Is she going to be like Illaoi where after 1 week she's just non-existant because she doesn't offer anything we don't have, or are you going to continually work on her? 
- What Was your intention of "smoothness/Clunkiness" when creating this champion, EXAMPLE: Ekko(very smooth W E Q R.) Or Zed: Everything is a ONLY IF my opponent does this.
- Finally, are you guys going to do something about those eyebrows? can't tell if that's shadow or Riot just trying to portray more ethnicity into the game. 

THANK YOU {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

 
#I hate it when people ask questions that aren't going to help the community understand
uh her eyebrows are fine as is. protect her.

The Podcast talks about your first question; the reasoning behind why no damage and three minutes were chosen. It also mentioned that CDR does lower the worked ground time. Can't remember if the podcast mentions the amount CDR will reduce worked grounds timer. Here is the address to the Podcast http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/inside-taliyah-dev-designers

So... will we be seeing the awkward moment when Taliyah realizes that Azir isn't the tyrant she thought him to be? Something like "Uh... whoops. Sorry about destroying your palace and all... heh..."

On to the real questions.

1. When you thought of a Shuriman champion, what made you think "stone mage?" Unless you guys just want to cover all the elements, then that's understandable.

2. How has Taliyah lasted so long in a world full of void creature invasions, sea krakens, and basically hellish weather? Do her powers give her innate durability, or is she just lucky?

3. How would Taliyah react to seeing Malphite? Would she be able to tear off chunks of him and the like, or is Malphite covered in a rock-like material that doesn't inhibit the properties Taliyah requires to use her powers?

4. What's with Shurima and walls these days? Seems like some hidden Trump card, if you ask me.

5. Less of a question about Taliyah herself, more about Shurima's Xer'Sai infestation. Has Azir started cleaning that up, or is he focused on other things? And would Xerath take care of them around his own empire?

6. Last question, I swear. Taliyah's scarf is awesome with those stones on the ends. Is that a special material, or did she just put those on the scarf for the coolness factor? I'm really digging that scarf.
Why did you give Taliyah the rock surfing passive. As a midlaner she isn't really walking to lane with continuous wall beside her.
What is her opinion on other places in the world like the Shadow Isles and Bildgewater. Also does she think there should be a void event soon?
Oh my god. In the Nasus story Xerath has followers calling him the new emperor of shruima. What if Tahlia mistaked Azir for Xerath?
Does she have a crush on {{champion:245}}?

1) does her passive activate on generated terrain (anivia, j4, Trundle)?
2)Do her innate and q Stack? how do they interact with other movement boosts?
3)does here ult's displace stop ally recall or other channels and does it activate e?
4)Do other displacements (blitz, thresh, yi, etc.) activate e?
5) if non-champs are displaced by w will they activate e?
6) does all damage (minions) or only champ and turret damage stop ult?
7)can w displace allies or herself?
8) how does the q different mana cost work with eternity and tear of the goddess?
9)is the ult a projectile for wind wall? 
10) for innates purpose: what is out of range of wall?
11) if done correctly could the ult trap people in an area like the dragon or baron pit or even just a corner of terrain?
12) does the e's 4 per champ limit mean an enemy can only destroy 4 rocks or can only take damage from 4 then keep destroying them damage free?
13)her w lasts up for a bit, what happens if someone touches it after it has been launched?
14) are the e's standard for dashes the same for poppy? does the protobelt count, does aurelion sol's comet count?
15) is taliyah definitely coming out in 6.10?
16) any upcoming skins for taliyah to look forward to(*cough*toph*cough*) like maybe a green chroma or a melon taliyah you can tell us about?
17) does she ever use her powers to mess with malphite? could she use them to mess with skarner?
18) unrelated, but would you rather face a 100 teemo sized malphites or 1 malphite sized teemo?
I'm really excited for her, i love mid mages and her abilities look so cool.

While I'm not a Riot employee, I'll try to answer as many as possible.  Any I'm unsure of or flat out don't know will be indented.

Edit: the indenting didn't stay.  Numbers I'm uncertain of are 3,6,8,9,12-14,16-18.

1) yes
2) yes (like every other %ms increase
     3) yes; probably?
4) yes
5) yes
     6) as said in ability details, just champion and turret (otherwise there'd be some lame moments going through the jung with it)

7) no
   8) the Q (on worked ground) refunds half of the mana cost; it doesn't actually cost less.  Therefore tear will effectively be 30% of the reduced cost on worked ground.

     9) I actually don't know, but probably
10) the range on her passive is a little odd, but it's just enough for you to go across jungle entrances without losing the speed at all.

11) of course, that's one of the huge uses of artificial walls in LoL
     12) I believe they can only destroy 4 rocks
     13) nothing
     14) yes, probably, probably not
15) If anything huge comes up, she will of course be delayed.
     16) That would be fantastic, but my guess is no
     17) Idk
   18) 100 teemo sized malphites (according to lore, yordles are ridiculously tiny whereas Malphite is larger than all of Summoner's Rift.
